title: Can I get 95 in class 10 maths without solving RD Sharma? - Quora
tags: Central Board of Secondary Education, India

response.answer_text: Yeah .You Of course could !!! I have secured 96 in class 10 Cbse exam 2017 !! Then why not you????? I referred only Ncert and oswaal Question Bank!!! Which was and is very much enough to get a good score . What is majorly important is how clear you know the concepts !! And I do agree according to my point of view that R D Sharma is a very huge book and certainly not that very important to score 95 + If u refer to the previous year papers and oswaal Question Bank along with Ncert examples and problems You definitely could!!! All the best

I'll tell you a true story, I never ever touched RD Sharma not RW Aggarwal. All I solved was NCERT (class 10th maths bhagavat gita)., sample papers, previous years question (oswaal) and school revision. During 10th mid term exam, the math question paper set by my school teachers was quite tough according to my other fellow classmates ( those who brag by telling they solved RD Sharma). Then one of my friend told me that most of the questions were from RD Sharma. Mid term results were outand I topped my class by getting 79.5 out of 80. And in boards I got 75 out of 80 ( lost in trigonometry) So the moral of the story is Solve NCERT, sample paper questions, previous years papers again and again and again aagain×10000000 All the best for your exams :)

Ofcourse you can… During my tenth I didn't even buy Rd Sharma. Solve all previous year question papers…it is really really really really helpful Refer all model papers and don't leave even a single question. I scored 94 in maths by solving only previous year question papers and NCERT exercise

Yes because CBSE is having board exam it has removed the grading system at that time paper used to be tough and most of the question were from RD Sharma . But now CBSE is having board and most almost questions come from ncert you can see previous 2–3 yrs ppr read ncert thoroghly every question you will definitely get it chill…

Hey! yes you can, by just solving ncert you can get 90% and above may be, depends upon you, how well you understand the topics, if you don’t understand the topics than nothing will going to work. if you understand the topics than everything will going to work.

Main concern is that your concepts should be clear.You should have practiced a lot. And you should have done a variety of problems of various difficulty levels.Now R D Sharma is a Bible for 10th students but if you have confidence that you have done ncert very well and you can solve previous year papers then you should be confident. for exam. I will not suggest to start a new book at last few days so better to revise whatever you have done NCERT textbook+previous year papersDon't make a specific Target but do your. BestBest of All
